comprehensive_overview: TenPy is a Python library for the simulation of strongly correlated quantum lattice models. It includes algorithms for finding ground states and low-energy excitations, as well as for time evolution and thermal equilibrium states. The library is designed to work efficiently with tensor networks in one and two dimensions, such as matrix product states and projected entangled pair states.
core_features: Simulation of strongly correlated quantum lattice models
Ground state and low-energy excitation calculations
Time evolution and thermal equilibrium state simulations
Efficient tensor network algorithms for 1D and 2D systems
Support for matrix product states and projected entangled pair states
